title: Muhammad Ali  by Thomas Hauser
description:
Decades after his final fight, Muhammad Ali remains larger
than life in the imagination of hundreds of millions of
people around the world. He won the heavyweight championship
at age twenty-two by conquering Sonny Liston in dramatic
fashion. The political establishment stripped him of his prize
when he refused induction into the United States Army during
the height of the war in Vietnam. Ultimately, Ali returned to
reclaim his crown, prevailing in epic fights against the likes
of Joe Frazier and George Foreman. His talent and charismaÃ¢â‚¬â€and
above all, his adherence to principleÃ¢â‚¬â€made him a cultural icon
and one of the most beloved sporting figures of all time.

But that is only half the tale. Muhammad Ali: His Life and
Times is also the story of Ali, the man. Author Thomas Hauser
got closer to Ali than any previous biographer. His workÃ¢â‚¬â€told
in AliÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own words and those of hundreds of family members,
friends, rivals, and others who interacted with Ã¢â‚¬Å“The GreatestÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
over the decadesÃ¢â‚¬â€reveals a deeply spiritual, complex man, who
gave new meaning to the word courage and changed forever our
conception of what makes a champion.

Muhammad Ali
